revised_title: Anatomy of the Central Nervous System in Vertebrate Animals: Ichthyopsida
tldr: This article examines the structure and development of the central nervous system in fish, specifically focusing on the anatomy of the brain and its components. The author provides detailed descriptions of various parts of the brain, including the olfactory lobes, cerebral lobes, optic lobes, cerebellum, and hypoaria. The study aims to improve understanding of the nervous system's development and function in vertebrates.
